page.title: 09SCHOOL
page.content: In 1984/85 the school roll was 15 and with political pressure to close rural schools, the school was threatened. The community attended in full force a meeting with the Director and the School Council and displayed very strong feelings about the high standard of education in the school which later gained an unconditional reprieve.The school has again a permanent Headteacher with 1 assistant and 19 pupils. The school was built in 1666. The schoolhouse was added in 1706 and the playground was provided in 1870. The roll in 1850 was as small as 3 and has reached 60 plus at other times.Now the school caters for children aged 5 to 12 years whereas it used to range to 14 years. Today children are busy in activity corners which are scattered around one large classroom.
